revision.comment: The geometric mean of two numb
revision.text:
The geometric mean of two numbers, say 2 and 8, is just the square root of their product; that is sqrt(2 x 8)=4 The geometric mean is defined as the nth root of the product of n numbers, i.e., for a set of numbers \{x_i\}_{i=1}^N, the geometric mean is defined as \left(\prod_{i=1}^N x_i\right)^{1/N}. La moyenne géométrique de n valeurs positives xi est la racine nième du produit de ces valeurs. Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran Jean-Marc Meunier Orlaith Burke Philippe Rocca-Serra https://en.wikipedia.org/wi
is a subclass from http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/STATO_0000029
